Mik, any thoughts on this one? It appears as though context.core didn't finish loading.
This is almost certainly what's causing the IStartup problem you are seeing.  What other plug-ins do you have installed?  I'm wondering if one of them could be providing a conflicting httpclient.
*** Bug 163837 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=53617)
Platform status

Have to attach trough browser view, Bugzilla view failed

Mik, here is my Eclipse platform status. I had problem attaching it in Bugzilla view (will file bug).
Also note, that the error "httpclient.protocol.ProtocolSocketFactory" was only one of the four workers (different classes)
that failed (timeout). I have reasonably fast machine 3Ghz, so it shouldn't timeout or the timeout should be extended?
Mik, see the stack trace provided by Lubos on bug#164115. It has more indication of class loading problems.
Lubos: could you try updating your VM to the latest and see if this still happens?
No, I did not get this message till I upgraded to 0.9. It can be closed.

Lubos: I'm confused about whether you mean that it was 9.0 that you got this with, in which case it may still be a problem.  Please try to upgrade to the latest developer build and reopen if it happens again: http://www.eclipse.org/mylar/dl.php
What I wanted to say is that I did not see this problem since I upgraded to Eclipse 3.2/Mylar 0.9. The bug can be closed.
